review: Google Chromecast works, but it can be frustrating trying to get your computer or smartphone to communicate reliably when you are trying to watch something. Commands sometimes seem to take an eternity to get through from the source to the TV. So say you need to pause for whatever reason, you press pause on the computer...and nothing happens. Press it again, nothing happens. Close out whatever you were watching entirely, and the TV JUST KEEPS GOING. It just doesn't work well. So three stars.
author: Andrew

review: I bought this, then subsequently got a Roku, thinking it would offer me "more."  But if you don't need more...  You don't. This gives me all I want at less than half the price. review: Three stars seems too harsh, but four stars feels a little generous.The Good:It's cheap. You can stream movies and music to your TV without having to shell out $100 for an Apple TV, or other device.Decent integration. Netflix, ESPN, and others automatically sync to the Chromecast.Plex Media Server - If you have a media collection, you can install Plex, and be able to very easily manage everything and play it directly through the Chromecast easily.The Bad:Whenever I turn on my TV and receiver, it takes anywhere between 1-5 minutes for the Chromecast to actually "boot" and start displaying anything on the TV.The connection to the Chromecast occasionally cuts out. This doesn't happen daily, but at least 1-3 times per week. It also sometimes seems to get confused when media is trying to connect to it, requiring you to stop casting, recast, then stop casting again, before the device refreshes and actually lets you stream whatever you had in your app or browser again.Bottom Line:It's an inexpensive device with a few quirks that could use a little bit more polish. The utility it provides, though, is far greater than whatever issues it has, and for $25-35, it works well enough to be worth the purchase. If you have a decent amount of media on your computer, if you watch a lot of Netflix, or ESPN, this is a viable alternative to AppleTV at a much cheaper price. Overall, recommended.
author: Henry Mayson
